details.name: Intuit | 11.22 - 11.23
details.description: Intuit is the parent company of TurboTax, Credit Karma, Mailchip, Mint, and Quickbooks. I worked on the TurboTax product building out new UI's and user flows in the "Tax Funnel"
keyPoints: Created new user flows in the TurboTax funnel using the internal design library, aligning with stakeholder requirements, and optimizing Start-to-Completion through A/B testing
Integrated AI/GPT-4 model endpoints to enable dynamic UI component inputs for next-gen TurboTax products
Presented key projects to over 40 engineers, including senior and director-level management

name: The Zebra — Software Engineer I & II

details.name: The Zebra | 03.21 - 11.22
details.description: The Zebra is an insurance tech company creating and innovating a new market space for insurance. We compare and advise on which insurance would be best for a consumer. Since launching my corporate software engineering career at The Zebra, I have had the unique opportunity to work on 3 different teams. I have worked on high volume landing pages, complex multi-party API’s on the backend, and most recently a user information funnel.
keyPoints: Co-developed the world’s first 3rd-party insurance-policy sales funnel with zero agent interaction, catering to the 87% of users preferring online purchases with no human interaction
Developed and updated landing page templates, including a homepage redesign, using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Wagtail, resulting in increased user engagement based on Optimizely A/B testing
Boosted policy sales and user experience by creating the company’s first transactional email system, integrating it with Iterable via a custom API
Engaged in company-wide initiatives, including reworking the interview process to enhance candidate quality and ensure equal opportunity

details.name: Freelance | 05.20 - 04.21
details.description: During this time I completed freelance work for a number of clients, usually updating and tweaking existing websites they owned but that were no longer being maintained by the original programmer. The majority of this work consisted of learning a codebase and then making changes involving but not limited to React, Javascript, HTML, and CSS. In addition to this, I was working with a small startup team to help build out their MVP using the same stack mentioned.
keyPoints: Updated and maintained pre-existing websites using React, Javascript, HTML, and CSS
Worked within a small team to build out an MVP following scrum and agile practices
